t: Psalm 109
Prayer against an Enemy
For the choir director. A psalm of David.
God*pn of my praise, do not be silent.
For*ln wicked and deceitful mouths open against me; they*ln speak against me with lying tongues.
They*ln surround me with hateful words and*ln attack me without cause.
In*ln return for my love they accuse me, but*ln I continue to pray.
They*ln repay me evil for good, and*ln hatred for my love.
Set*pn a wicked person over him; let*ln an accuser stand at his right hand.
When*ln he is judged, let him be found guilty, and*ln let his prayer be counted as sin.
Let*ln his days be few; let*ln another take over his position.
Let*ln his children be fatherless and*ln his wife a widow.
Let*ln his children wander as beggars, searching*ln for food far from their demolished homes.
Let*ln a creditor seize all he has; let*ln strangers plunder what he has worked for.
Let*ln no one show him kindness, and*ln let no one be gracious to his fatherless children.
Let*ln the line of his descendants be cut off; let*ln their name be blotted out in the next generation.
Let*ln the iniquity of his fathers be*ln remembered before the Lord,*s and*ln do not let his mother’s sin be blotted out.
Let*ln their sins always remain before the Lord,*s and*ln let him remove all memory of them from the earth.
For*pn he did not think to show kindness, but*ln pursued the suffering, needy, and brokenhearted in*ln order to put them to death.
He*ln loved cursing — let it fall on him; he*ln took no delight in blessing — let it be far from him.
He*ln wore cursing like his coat — let*ln it enter his body like water and*ln go into his bones like oil.
Let*ln it be like a robe he wraps around himself, like*ln a belt he always wears.
Let*ln this be the Lord’s*s payment to my accusers, to*ln those who speak evil against me.
But*pn you, Lord,*s my Lord, deal*ln kindly with me for your name’s sake; because*ln your faithful love is good, rescue me.
For*ln I am suffering and needy; my*ln heart is wounded within me.
I*ln fade away like a lengthening shadow; I*ln am shaken off like a locust.
My*ln knees are weak from fasting, and*ln my body is emaciated.
I*ln have become an object of ridicule to my accusers; when*ln they see me, they shake their heads in scorn.
Help*pn me, Lord*s my God; save*ln me according to your faithful love
so*ln they may know that this is your hand and*ln that you, Lord,*s have done it.
Though*ln they curse, you will bless. When*ln they rise up, they will be put to shame, but*ln your servant will rejoice.
My*ln accusers will be clothed with disgrace; they*ln will wear their shame like a cloak.
I*ln will fervently thank the Lord*s with my mouth; I*ln will praise him in the presence of many.
For*ln he stands at the right hand of the needy to*ln save him from those who would condemn him.
